page.title: 13Food We Eat
page.content: This is a survey on what children aged from 4 to 11 years had for breakfast dinner and tea in 1985.The most popular breakfast food was cereal 73%, toast 32% and tea 21%, surprisingly 10% of the children had nothing to eat for breakfast.Our school has 3 choices of what to do for lunch, school dinners, sandwiches or home dinner 24% of the school have school dinners 49% have sandwiches and 21% go home to dinners.More and more children are changing to sandwiches.For the min meal in the evening the most popular food was chips 36% which was not unusual because most children love chips, then was potatoes with 21% then sausages 14%.The most popular vegetable was peas with 16% .The top 2 in pudding were ice-cream 22% and cake was 10%.Also 20% of the children had nothing for pudding.
